translated: The Elder Ekāsani
“My name was Varuṇa,
I was a king of the gods then.
I attended on the Buddha,
with my retinue and my army.
When the Lord of the World had passed away,
the supreme one who sees what is beneficial,
I took all the musical instruments
and went to the supreme Bodhi tree.
With music and dance,
delighted with the sound of the cymbals,
I attended on the supreme Bodhi tree
as if the Buddha were present.
Having attended on that Bodhi tree,
the tree that is the foot of the earth,
I sat down cross-legged
and there I died.
I was satisfied with my own deeds,
and I had confidence in the supreme Bodhi tree.
By that confidence in my mind,
I was reborn in a divine mansion.
Six thousand musical instruments
always surrounded me,🔽as I went through rebirths in the world,
